instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00431: What is 820-00431? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video Lightning Strike
threads.message:
This iMac the customer said stop responding to video when lightning struck.
I have narrowed the power rails down to no voltage on <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_REG</SIGNAL>.
The 4 LED's, only 1, 2, and 3 light up. Even if I plug in the screen from the iMac, it never recognizes the screen by lighting up that 4th LED.
I get no video by plugging in via thunderbolt.
All USB connections give me the 5v.
I get no chime through the speakers.
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> is there. 
I am stumped. Dead onboard video graphics chip?
Thermal camera shows the image below.
[ATTACH type="full"]61195[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video Lightning Strike
threads.message:
Do you get CPU core?
Try known good BIOS, clean ME.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video Lightning Strike
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 99739, member: 682"]
Do you get CPU core?
[/QUOTE]
Yes, I do. I will try the BIOS. Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00431</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video Lightning Strike
threads.message:
No go with flashing the BIOS, I am however seeing only the 1st and 2nd LED light up. I am not sure if I got the right bin file. I found this one off of Badcaps.net
[URL='https://www.badcaps.net/forum/attachment.php?attachmentid=218259&d=1597857549']9.5.3.1526_SLM_PRD_outimage.rar[/URL]
